text: This place is worth a mention. It's stands slightly above a Denny's or an IHOP. I will always gravitate to the eateries that prepare there foods fresh daily. This appears to be one of those places, however some dishes are suspect. To mention any particular menu item is pointless if food is fresh and prepared with a modicum of care the meal will express that. That's what  I use as a gage to measure the true value of an establishment. Otherwise it's just not worth mentioning. Keeping that in mind it's safe to say you can enjoy almost anything you order here. Breakfast ,lunch, or dinner.

This is always a must-stop for me when visiting family in Chicago.  It is a great neighborhood diner, and the owner always makes a point of stopping by our table to say hello to my Great Aunt who has lived in the neighborhood for decades, as well as the rest of us.  I have been going here ever since I was a little kid, way before the remodel occurred.
I love this place. It's around the corner from my condo. Food good, big menu, big portions. Coffee is wonderful. Outside seats. Small patio but enough.

Stopped by The Original Alps for a quick Sunday morning breakfast while visiting friends in Chicago. The interior was nicer than I expected as I had thought it may be a little run down. Service was friendly and quick. Husband had the Irishmans Skillet (which came with pancakes) and loved it! I had the Ladies Special #2 (pancakes, eggs, sausage, hash browns). Food was served fast and fresh. And lets just say there was a lot there! I finished my special (barely) and was not hungry the rest of the day. Husband ate half of his and took the rest for later. When we are back in the area will stop by for another breakfast. Large portions for a reasonabel price!

This place used to be great but since I last visited a few months ago, they increased prices and decreased portion sizes. Additionally, they serve cappuccino from a machine. It is full of sugar and tasting disgusting. What respectable restaurant serves coffee from a machine? How hard it is to make cappuccino? Certain servers are very rude. Suggestion: your tips depend on your attitude and you are not getting much right now.

Visiting Chicago for the day, this came highly recommended from close friends. Turned out to be a great breakfast! Will definitely return if ever in the area again. I had the stuffed french toast with house-made filling, icing and whipped cream, all topped with strawberries. Delish! The wait staff was very friendly and definitely made the atmosphere / experience enjoyable and memorable.
Really friendly staff and extensive breakfast menu. Vegetarian and dog friendly, good patio for when the weather is nice. Reasonably priced, will definitely be returning.

I had high expectations from all the rave reviews and positive feedback I've gotten from friends. Now that I finally got to try it, Alps is your average breakfast restaurant. They have your traditional breakfast menu with a selection of a few breakfast specials. They specialize in breakfast items but also carry sandwiches, salads, steaks, and more. I got the potato pancake special listed on the menu w/ bacon and sour cream which I did enjoy. I do like the atmosphere of the restaurant. They do provide a good amount of serving to their dishes. I guess I was just expecting a bit more on the food but I'm willing to come here again and try something different.

First time here to meet with my friend for breakfast. Have a variety of choice...they serve lunch. Love their choice of omelettes and skillets. The environment is very nice and servers are friendly. There is a parking lot. That's a plus.

This is just another cheap American breakfast place where the food has no quality. You can tell the hashbrowns are frozen and the cooks don't even bother to use salt or pepper. How do you mess up hashbrowns??? Their omletes were bland and someone should teach them how to cook their vegetables thoroughly. I don't understand how this place is still open to be honest. Do not bother with this place and I rather eat at Golden Nugget's overpriced breakfast. I don't know why I gave this place 3 chances to sell me boring ass food.  Only good thing about this place is that they do have a parking lot and the environment is clean and welcoming which is very misleading

Great neighborhood breakfast restaurant. Traditional breakfast dishes with some unique specials. An extra plus is the great staff. Everyone is very friendly and the service is attentive. Will be back numerous times!

Great breakfast prices!! The food is really good and I love how clean it is in the restaurant. The orange juice is fresh and the coffee is perfect. Even the syrup for the pancakes is nice and hot. The staff is very friendly and welcoming.

Been to Alps a few times before and was pretty satisfied with the service and food, but I called yesterday simply just to ask how long the wait would be and the guy who answered was super rude and pretty much laughed at my face told me of course they were busy then hung up on me.  He needs to take a phone etiquette class

Arrived to the restaurant for Mother's Day looking to get seated & was received by this man with the rudest attitude. It was unbelievable how he treated us. We did have a big party however instead of saying they could not accommodate he simply said "good luck with that" This is not how you treat a customer. As we left he yelled "thank you" "thank you" What a way to treat a customer on Mothers Day with my children.

This is a long-standing, Old Irving stand by. Bob Theo and his family have run an amazing business for years.  They recently re-invented themselves to serve the community. With an updated healthy menu that has wonderful, fresh, hand picked produce and the old stand-bys that we can't live without. You will always find all foods fresh and flavorful. Bob's high standards of tasty food is always served with the the best fruits and veggies. Stop in for the amazing spinach-feta omelet that is out of this world or try a healthy wrap! They reinvent the wrap to include only the best ingredients. Or try his daily specials. They are always a wonderful healthy "home inspired" special that will give you that warm 'fresh from Mom's oven' feeling. You will also find that Easter and Christmas is a special time at the restaurant for children as the Easter bunny and Santa are regular visitors. Yes, they love families. Crayons are always at the ready. Mother's day.... they'll never forget you. You will see Bob, the owner, and family as you walk in. Undoubtedly, they will greet you at the door or pop in to make sure your meal and experience is wonderful. It's 5-star treatment for their customers. They DO have convenient parking in the rear and metered street parking available. Weekends ARE very busy, so stop by early and beat the crowd. Don't forget to stop by and enjoy the fantastic flowers at the sidewalk cafe during the warm months.

I live 0.4 miles away & my food came cold. I called to tell them, asked what they could do for me, and the guy told me I could come in and get a free bowl of soup. Thumbs down all the way. Don't waste your money. Appalling.

So we decided to go to The Alps restaurant this rainy morning to treat ourselves. What happened instead was an overpriced breakfast that made us both sick to our stomachs almost immediately after we ate. We didn't order the same thing but what we did have in common were the eggs. We will never go back or recommend anyone go there. We don't know if the eggs were bad or undercooked doesn't matter no one should get ill after eating!
Great diner restaurant. Family owned. Like stepping back in time.  Wish they were open for dinner.

What can I say about this place ouf horrible just so so so bad. They need to shut this bad boy down. Ordered and it came on time but god dam this food is horrible. Asked for cheese on eggs and I legit got a kraft single on my eggs. The skillet I ordered is terrible the hash browns were obviously not fresh and undercooked And more kraft single. Just so terrible make your own breakfast at home never again! Flavorless and poorly cooked.  Ok and the pancakes how do you eff up pancakes they taste stale and horrible. This place is just DISGUSTING!!!

Food is awesome, service is kind and friendly. I had breakfast here while visiting Chicago from Detroit.  I had the Big Man breakfast and everything was well prepared.  Had my wife and kids along and they all were very satisfied.  They know what they are doing and they take pride in it.  I noticed some historical pictures on one wall and the owner was nice enough to share how he had been in that location for more than 40 years.  I'm glad we had the pleasure of finding this place right off Irving.
Best breakfast in the area. Fast prompt service and hot fresh meal every time.  The decor is great.  Strawberry crepes and pollo skillet are our favorites.  This place is really good.

I had been going to this place every Sunday for a while because of the location even though the food is very average and overpriced. For some reason there are people waiting to eat here and after about 20 minutes, the two of us got a booth. The eggs and hash browns are ok, even though everything seems to be 2.00 overpriced. My main problem with the place is that for the third week in a row , the manager guy came over to our table and told us we were there too long and had to leave. He tried to be nice about it, but he was basically telling us to leave. If this had only happened once , I'd be ok, but 3 weeks in a row and I'm done with this place for good. Just plain rude .

I had always seen this place but never stopped in due to it being located on busy intersection.  A client of mine scheduled a business breakfast there.  What I didn't know was they have free parking in the back.  The place has been remodeled, looks great, it's bright and clean.  They have an updated menu and the spinach omelette was very good.  I also took my family there a short time later on super bowl sunday and the experience was again very good.  It is my new place for breakfast.
Good restaurant. The owners are very sweet and very friendly when you walk in you feel welcomed. The food is good I love their crepes and breakfast is great! Totally reccomend for lunch or breakfast.
Always wanted to dine in at this Irving Park landmark. Ordered the crepes. Fantastic. Will return for early bird special.

Great place for a hangover cure. I used to live just down the street and you could find me her every Sunday morning in my pj's. There can be a wait sometimes but it's totally worth it. Freshly squeezed juice and the fresh veggies they add to the skillets are unreal. I have even gone here alone and the servers are so friendly I didn't feel alone.

Free parking in the back of the restaurant. The food is pretty good and imho taste just like what you expect in a diner.  I had chicken rice soup and the Alps burger and the burger may be a little bland but I don't mind. Guess everyone taste is different but I'll come back one day to try their breakfast deal at $5.99 from 6-9am. Friendly workers who constantly check on you for your needs and when you pay you pay up front at the cash register.

Alps is the best! The staff is great, the wait is never long, the food is amazing and the portions are huge! I've been coming here for years.  A few weeks ago,  I was here with my two young daughters and they needed to use the bathroom.  We were almost finished with our meals, but not quite.  The bus boy accidentally cleared our table while we were up and by the time we got back to our table our waitress had already put our orders back in and they were about to come back out. Amazing service!

i HAVE NEVER HAD A BAD MEAL HERE. Portions are ample. Service is excellent. Juice is fresh. Eggs are done how you ask. Wait time is minimal as they are very organized and it is a huge place.  EXTREMELY DOG FRIENDLY DURING THE SUMMER - If you want to walk with your dog and grab a bite to eat - come to ALPS! Everyone there from the owners to the waitresses love dogs. They bring them treats and water. IT's really fun for them and us. And it is shaded on the outside patio.

My mother and I came in on Thanksgiving morning after mass. We ordered food from Juanita who is a very Stellar waitress! We waited probably the better part of two minutes between ordering and receiving our food - that's fast! She came by the table once more to ask how the food tasted....mind you not how "everything was"...prime example of a terrific server! Aces all around!  Thanks , Juanita and Alps!!!

This is one of those Greek American diners where the owners think his employees and customers are like family.  One of my best friends lives near here and he's been a regular for over a couple of decades...and he's not anywhere near one of the oldest longtime regulars.  Recently remodeled it's much nicer than most family diners, it's sunny and comfortable.  Breakfast is the best meal, but all the usual diner choices are great, the service is always excellent, but the best thing about the place is how community oriented the owner is.  He always donates to the neighborhood for the park and such.  He knows scores of regulars by name and the whole staff seems to love what they do.  I guarantee you'll feel better and yet be uncomfortably too full when you leave here.

This place is not fancy, but it is delicious. My husband and I share the Mexican omelette and usually the two of us don't always finish the whole plate. There is a LOT of food on the plate! Their skillets are not great (ask for the hashbrowns to be well done and let them know you are prepared to wait, otherwise you will be eating near raw potatoes, veggies and over easy eggs.) Coffee is also not great, but it's in our neighborhood and the Mexican omelette hits the spot.
Not my favorite. Food was alright. Service was alright. I don't know if I'll be back or not. Didn't really leave there crazy about the place.

Great breakfasts, good service, free parking. The Mexican breakfasts are outstanding.  Huge menu with something for everyone.  The ham served with eggs is on the bone:  delicious. Waitresses are very attentive, ready to refill your coffee.  Prices are reasonable.  Customer base very eclectic, families, couples, cops, seniors, etc.
Pleasantly surprised at the inside. Don't judge a book by its cover. The food and service was top notch. The inside of the restaurant has been remodeled. I definitely will be back. THANKS
Food was fine but way too expensive. Best deal is come from 6am-9am for breakfast special. Getting breakfast at lunch time is too expensive

We came here last Saturday in the early afternoon with a crowd of 10 people.  We didn't have to wait long before they seated us.  That was a plus.  We ordered breakfast, mostly.  I looked at the menu ahead of time and found the skillet I wanted.  It had corned beef hash, potatoes  veggies and eggs and did not disappoint.  However, I think the rest of the group thought it was just okay.  The salsa with one of the Mexican entrees was just gross.  Our waitress bordered on surly (arguing with one of our guests about what comes with a particular meal). I would go again to eat the skillet, but there are many places that serve something similar - nothing makes this place stand out.
I'm a regular here. If you want a traditional breakfast, this is the place.  These reviews are bs, the owners are so friendly and accommodating & I have never seen disrespect come from this place.

I have always called for pick up at this establishment. Today I called and young lady answered appropriately; however, some rude man took the phone from her hands and said very rudely  "you know what if you have a  small order we are really busy so why dont you come here order food it would only take a couple of minutes anyways" then he hung up the phone on me.   So it would only take a minute to take my order over the phone but you dont have time to take my order? The time it took for him to be obnoxious and rude i could have placed my order and been on my way to pick it up.   I will never eat at this place again and i will ensure  all my friends and family who eat here regularly not come here ever again. This way  they will resolve part of their problem of being too busy to service and be respectful to their regular customers.
I come here once a week for breakfast. Good food, great service and reasonable prices. Waffles with fresh fruit and turkey sausage. Good coffee.

You can't go wrong with breakfast @ the Alps. This is the usual breakfast stop for my wife and I. Family friendly and food comes out of the kitchen pretty quick. My suggestion for the Alps would be to improve the quality of your pancakes. Tastes like its made with water, can use more flavor. And also better coffee. Despite that still gets 4 stars.

We ate here twice and on the second visit we ordered less and they changed more so I talked to the owner about the difference he said maybe I owed him more money for the first visit He was not kidding We will not go back from the way he talked to us and overall how he handled the situation !!!Not a nice man !!

This place is rude to women customers.  I was there for 1.5 hours and had a large breakfast, tea, then later ordered some coffee while I was working.  The owner came up and told me I had been there 3 hours, he would not have seated me there if he knew I was going to stay so long and basically berated me about how the waitress wasn't making any money.  There were two tables of men who had been there just as long and he did not say a word to them.  KEY:  There was NO ONE waiting and at least TEN tables open.  I left my fresh cup of coffee, went to pay and said to the next guy - you know this could have been handled better.  He proceeded to yell at me and tell me I had no common sense and didn't understand the restaurant industry (even though I tipped the waitress $5 for my $10 breakfast).  I'm 10 months pregnant and due tomorrow. Who can't let a pregnant lady sit for a while at a diner?  Who kicks a pregnant lady out of their restaurant period?  The food is not that good, the location was just convenient.  Please don't give your money to such poorly behaved old men.  Go down the street to Cafe Urbano.

So, a coworker recommended this place and I was looking for a new place close to home. I like Eggs Benedict and was told they were good. Actually horrible. The sauce was very odd. They provide mounds of potatoes. Mounds. Pancakes are very good. Typical diner, nothing special. No plans to return.

If you liked breakfast at this place then you haven't had breakfast yet.  Horrible breakfast experience. I'd rather eat breakfast at McDonald's than walking into this place again. Over priced for no o reason. I get the whole mom and pop spirit but that shouldn't prevent you from rocking breakfast. No espresso. Overcooked bacon. Undercooked hashB. NO GOOD

Pretty average breakfast places, as they say a typical dinner. It's nice inside, clean, and the staff is super friendly. The food is average its not bad by all means but it is as if I would have made it myself at home. I ordered the French toast, I figured it was a good choice and it was so so, I was hoping there was something special about them but no just regular French toast (believe me I wanted to love them)  I wanted to try new breakfast places since this spot is not too far from my neighborhood but I won't be returning. Overall very average on the food.

my favorite place for breakfast always want to try something new but cant stay away from the the hobo skillet . they feed you good portion at a very resonable price and you get your food rather quickly

ALPS West is a great place in the Irving Park neighborhood.  They have fantastic breakfasts and something for everyone. They are open for breakfast and lunch and do a great job with both.  They have been around for ages, years ago as the original ALPS, then it became a bank, and then back to a wonderful place to dine. Stop in and visit, have breakfast or lunch, you won't be disappointed.

This place was great! Everything was fresh, homemade, and delicious. I got the Country Fried Steak. I was a little weirded out when I saw that it was basically a fried hamburger patty, but I could tell the beef was fresh and not frozen and that it was REAL meat! Our waitress was super friendly and the manager gave us the warmest greeting. I very much so appreciated that they were open on Christmas morning and I look forward to going here again.
They have good food good service it a very nice place to come with your family they will make you feel like family
The best broccoli and feta cheese omelette,  my daughter love the pancakes and waffles. The customer  service is great. And the ambiance is really quiet and nice.

I'd give it at least a 3 if it wasn't that I'm fed up with the place. I was a customer for years, but not any more. I got tired of their waitress Janie being rude not only to me, but others that I know for no reason. Simply doing her job pisses her off. I've tried being overly nice, complimenting, making small talk, but she just has a bitter, having a bad day every day attitude. If I enjoyed people being overly rude to me for no reason, I would patronize Ed Debevic's or the Weiner Circle.  Regarding the food, it is cooked perfectly fine (the cooks do it excellent and SUPER fast!), the problem is that all of their food is SO bland! They literally don't season anything! I think the cooks aren't allowed to, they must not be.  Also, the owners are nice enough, but when they screw up (it's happened several times over the years), they don't do anything to make it up. They give you a half assed apology if you're lucky and that's it. Nothing to make up for your trouble & time for having to go back to their restaurant for missing/wrong items etc., when it was their fault.

We are in LOVE. After reading some terrific Yelp reviews my boyfriend and I decided to give this place a try. We were very pleased! The efficiency of the host was superb and the cleanliness of the restaurant was excellent. But the FOOD was perfect, exactly what we were looking for... Diner food! We showed up in our pjs, drank coffee, and enjoyed our experience. So glad there are places like ALMAS. We will definitely be back!

Took my parents for the first time two weekend ago. They were so impressed, especially because the coffee kept coming, they have decided to make the trip  here than go somewhere near home. We commute about 25 mins to get here. So worth it!!!

Service was amazing! We were greeted at the door and seated right away. Our waitress, Megan, was busy but was super polite and professional.  Our food was served quickly. The scrambled eggs were fluffy, the hash browns were cut thick, and the pancakes were great.  All in all, great food, friendly staff, quick service AND free parking. I will be coming back.

Missed a flight out of town so decided to find a breakfast place on my way into the office. I remembered this orange looking awning on my daily drive in and figured I'd give it a whirl. Service was super fast, waitress while business like, was amazingly efficient. Got the gyros and eggs (don't often see that combo) and loved it. A touch pricey but overall this place is a score.

ALPS is very close to my heart.  I used to live close by and probably here at least 3 times a month and they never failed me. I like seeing how the owner greets the customer, how they appreciate your business and they're attentive to your needs. I've like almost everything I've had in here. I like my corned beef skillet and the pancakes!

The Alps is my favorite diner in the city. It isn't pretentious at all-and all so delicious and well made. Their omelets are awesome. They're always fluffy and always have a perfect ratio of egg to toppings. The Southern Omelet is not to be missed. The hash browns though aren't anything to write home about. I prefer mine shredded. They always have a wide variety of tea, which I appreciate. Their lunch is good too. Their french fries are delicious! Service is always on point. Love you, Alps!

If you are looking for a typical breakfast diner, that looks cool like a diner should, head right over.  Although, if you are looking for a place that you can throw a dart at the menu and have a happy belly, walk on by...walk on by. Solid eggs and breakfast in general, but don't you dare order anything like gyro sandwich, like hubby-bubby (F.K.A Fe-Fe) did this weekend.  All I can say is, "that came out of a box" for 1000, Alex.  Final answer: Stick to the breakfast basics and avoid yourself the trouble of a wtf session.
Hope you like a side of egg with your chorizo grease, i ordered huevos con chorizo and they where swimming in it.

Second time around I went in, in hopes of having a different experience. I came in with some friends and the host and waitress were equally rude. Don't get me wrong the food is delicious but I'm not sure if it's worth the bad attitude.

Being from out of town, I enjoy trying brunch spots whenever I do travel. Upon seeing this place and browsing menu, they had quite a few choices of skillets which I love! The service was good and food came out quickly! I ordered the country fried steak skillet, my friend got the lumberjack skillet and we were very satisfied! It was so much food we took leftovers home. If I am in town again I would definitely come back to try out the different skillets.

The food was great, and the price was right!  Went with some friends on a slow moving Saturday morning (slow moving for us, and by morning I mean more like 1pm). Because of our timing for breakfast there was no wait and our food was rather prompt, though this may be how it always is.  We all got different things, they got scramblers which looked great and were packed with great looking ingredients. I got an omelet and it was very good. Everything came with a side of toast or pancakes, so there was no shortage on portion size.  The place is rather large and there is parking on the side of the building, though it did seem like a sort of small lot. Perhaps plan to park on the streets nearby.

This is my favorite Breakfast spot in Chicago. They're fast, the food is great, and the service is fantastic. I've been coming here for about a decade now, and I hope to be able to keep coming back for the next decade too.
You are greeted at door by owner, very welcoming and clean.  Service and food are superb for breakfast and brunch, always packed. Reasonably priced for high quality.

Can't give it zero stars, but if I could, I would.  We live in the neighborhood and having been coming to this restaurant since it opened.  Fair to good diner food.  However, on our last visit, the waitress was so incredibly rude that we left.  I don't care how busy or overwhelmed you are, there is absolutely NO REASON to growl and scowl at customers who are simply perusing their menus.  A further insult resulted when I explained to reason for our premature departure to the owner/host.  He knew immediately which waitress had been rude, based on my description of her  behavior.  He dismissed my comments venturing that the waitress was just trying to be funny.  NOT AMUSED.  I guess he can blow off complaints as long as there's a line at the door.

Can't give it zero stars, but if I could, I would.  We live in the neighborhood and having been coming to this restaurant since it opened.  Fair to good diner food.  However, on our last visit, the waitress was so incredibly rude that we left.  I don't care how busy or overwhelmed you are, there is absolutely NO REASON to growl and scowl at customers who are simply perusing their menus.  A further insult resulted when I explained to reason for our premature departure to the owner/host.  He knew immediately which waitress had been rude, based on my description of her  behavior.  He dismissed my comments venturing that the waitress was just trying to be funny.  NOT AMUSED.  I guess he can blow off complaints as long as there's a line at the door.

1st of all great service, they treat you like family. Food is great & fresh. Very very attentive. Patio seating outside. They welcome your pooch. I felt comfortable being there. Such lovely owners. God bless them.
Food was delicious, plenty of tables and the coffee was better then your typical breakfast diner coffee.  The parking was very convenient.  Great restaurant in a good location.

Very surprised.  Nice to find an old shool style breakfast diner in the neighborhood that is modern (recently renovated), clean and airy. The service was exceptional and the food came out lightning fast and was fresh and delicious!  They have free parking and an outdoor patio in the warmer months.  A true diamond in the rough!
Stumbled upon this restaurant, what a pleasure to receive all fresh products and great service.
I've come her many times for breakfast. Always had good food, reasonable prices, and friendly faces. I had a grill cheese with bacon for lunch. It was so good! Love this place.

have been here many times over the years, but after the experience today will never go back  I feel sorry for the employees that have to put up with the cook in the kitchen.   We ordered biscuits and gravy with sausage and eggs  We had to return the biscuits because they tasted raw and uncooked. The cook(???) came out screaming at us that he has been making them the same for years.  not  once but 5 times. Totally uncalled for. never again!!!

Best in class. The Alps isn't trying to be a hot brunch spot or a foody cafe. It's a diner, plain and simple... but the cleanest and brightest one I know of. Want some unpretentious eggs, pancakes, bacon, skillets, etc? Look no further. A greasy spoon without the greasiness.

I'd give it 3 1/2 stars if that was an option... I'm somewhere between "A-OK" and "Yay! I'm a fan".  The owner and managers are always nice and attentive. The service is always good; the waitstaff are always nice.  I've only been there for breakfast and went this morning. Its a consistent basic neighborhood restaurant with a descent  menu and reasonable prices. There isn't anything on the menu that has me saying, "you HAVE to go to Alps and try the..." The bacon is a little crispier than I would like, the crepes are not really crepes (thinly made pancakes with whatever wrapped in them), and the coffee is a little better than fine. All that said I have never been disappointed or had something that was terrible or needed to send back.  It's in a good location - I recommend a window seat when possible - great people watching opportunities. I go there not to be disappointed or blown away and get exactly what I expect every time.
Just an average sit-down breakfast restaurant in the hood.  Their food is alright, nothing impressive. Slow service. Huge portion per plate.

This morning I had the chorizo skillet, and it was absolutely delicious. Our service was charming, our server joked with us and made sure that our coffee cups were always full of the wonderful coffee. The parking was great and it was a comfortable place to sit and chat.
Food here is delicious and to be sincere, the prices were extremely fair. I would definitely come back here. Had a burger and the meat was just right.

Have you read the book "Unbroken"? Its about Louis Zamparini and his amazing story of survival and redemption during and after WWII. I could not put it down. And the folks at ALPS must have sensed my urgency to keep reading this book because they let me linger much longer than probably the average diner lingers after breakfast. Smiling as they refilled my coffee and water glass, making sure I didn't need anything more. And it wasn't just the server either, the owner and cashier were both so nice and sunny on a cloudy, cold day. Maybe they saw the tears brimming in my eyes from such a gripping story that they wanted to be extra nice to me.  Get the window seats if you can, watching the traffic drive by is a great mindless activity. The food is good, hearty and filling.  I always go with the veggie skillet and poached eggs.  Their poaching technique isn't the best, but at least the eggs are not overcooked and gummy. The coffee is strong and hot; they have flavored creamers for you ready on the table.  I've only come for breakfast, well, I did come for lunch and ordered breakfast instead. That's what I love about these casual diners. Breakfast comfort food anytime you want.

Was just ok. My aunt and I stopped in and were greeted and seated immediately- 8am. We ordered the big man special and house special which were 5.49 from 6-9am. Really wanted steak and eggs but they were a little over priced. Ordered turkey bacon and turkey sausage. The meat tasted weird. Neither of us cared for it- had an "old" taste to them. Eggs and hash browns were good- really liked their french toast. Waitress was nice and attentive without being over bearing. Coffee was always filled quickly. We left and were given a nice goodbye on the way out. Don't love it- but don't hate it either.

This is a standard breakfast/brunch/lunch spot.. usually packed so be prepared to wait. I generally get breakfast and I have had a little bit of everything on  the menu. I would say pancakes are a good solid, but nothing special. I especially like their skillets and omelets. Coffee is great also and some specials come with juice so yay! Great service and friendly staff.. I am always greeted with a smile.. That is why I do not mind the wait.
Good brunch spot, friendly service, great variety. Wish they could do mimosas. Definitely go.
Nothing special but not bad. Everything you'd expect from a diner. Lunch / breakfast that's cheap. This place tends to cater to an older crowd.

I absolutely love Alps.  Great neighborhood diner.  I highly recommend any one of their skillet dishes.  Large portions and big flavor.  Same friendly staff every time you go in.  I miss going there weekly since I moved out of the neighborhood.  If you're in the area, stop in.  You won't regret it.

The food was great! I had the big man breakfast special and I loved it. I would go back to try other dishes. It was also inexpensive. The service was also great. I would definitely recommend this place.

I live in the neighborhood and wanted to take out of town guest for breakfast. My guest had the breakfast special  2 french toast, and two eggs with 4 sausage link. I think her french toast was perfect. I had the two pancakes, with two eggs and 4 bacon special. Oh let me not forget the hash brown potatoes. It was quite a bit of food for the $8.19 each. The beverages was how the ticket for two got to be right at 24.00. Next time I will split my breakfast. It was a lot of food. The service was excellent, and the place is newly remodeled. I heard the owner say it had only been a month. So nice diner for the neighborhood.

I've come here pretty often and here are some of my thoughts: Breakfast is a bit overpriced. The food, while good, could be better. Why is the default cheese on an omelette american cheese? Sure it's cheaper for Alps to use, but why? It's not as good as cheddar. Also, prices for said omelette are high- over $8, but if you come weekdays before 9am, its on special. That's another thing too- they aren't very flexible on specials. If it says ham and cheese and you're vegetarian, they gave us a hard time about getting it minus the ham for the special weekday price (are you kidding?). Lunch is good, and priced way better than breakfast. I get a chicken sandwich with mushroom, cheese, and bacon, plus soup, and fries for the same price as the omelette.  The service tends to be very good most the time, there sometimes is a wait on weekend mornings which moves fast. Overall, it's a decent place if you don't mind the somewhat high prices for breakfast.

This place is great for larger parties due to there extremely large variety of dishes, so everyone is sure to find something that sounds appealing! As for the service, the hostess and cashiers are extremely friendly and genuine, it doesn't seem fake nor scripted. The servers seem friendly but definitely are too busy to chit chat, which is fine!  The food...unfortunately isn't as "home cooked" as a foodie would like. The consistency is to the tee, eggs and meats are cooked correct (for the most part) but the taste is sadly over processes and it's a little too obvious that all of it is coming from the freezer :( Lastly, the price is average but I can't see myself paying that much for no flavor.

We live in the neighborhood and this diner only two block away offering good affordable diner atmosphere for all types.  Obviously weekend hours require some waiting but it's never been more than ten minutes in our experience. I wouldn't say it's crowded but it certainly can be "jumping" in those high volume hours. Any off time of the week, it's comfortable and relaxing. Because of the proximity I have order TAKE OUT a few times and always find it affordable versus even McDonalds and other close FAST FOOD places.    A neighborhood place that tries and it shows!
Yum, yum, and more yum.  Everytime I've been here its fast, hot, and delicious!  I expect to be visiting here weekly or by weekly for a while.

The Alps is solid diner.  It's clean and recently renovated, with a mix of tables and booths.  It's not gourmet or fancy, but has solid diner food.  It's also reasonably priced, and is good for kids (as all diners should be).   I usually get the veggie skillet, and they accommodate my (probably annoying) requests to substitute cheeses, and get the eggs on the side.  (I'm a big fan of skillets, and this one is pretty good.)    My kids happily eat the pancakes, sausage and eggs.   My husband usually gets soup and a club sandwich, which is decent, but club sandwiches aren't really my thing.   The service is usually prompt, and it's easy to get the wait staff's attention if you need something.  The wait staff is probably not the friendliest, but I think they are efficient and accommodating.   IThey are also kid-friendly, and bring crayons/coloring book pages for the kids when you are seated.       I

Is there a 0 star? Because the owner is a huge unprofessional jerk that made an embarrassing scene in front of all the customers when we returned a new menu item 'chilliques' as soon as it got to the table cuz it was disgusting looking and was not delivered until the rest of my party had finished eating because the waitress went on a break!  We felt we should not have to pay for it. But instead he came out yelling about being in business for 40 years and knows what he is doing. But truly it was a can of chili dumped on top of chips and added an egg to the top. I am latin and know this meal so what I got is def gross and My dog eats better!

The worst Resturant experience in the last 30 years.  Avoid this place at all cost.  We orders one of their new breakfast plates that should never attempt to make.  Owner was very abrasive loud and very arrogant.  He cannot take rejection of the food which we returned without touching and did not even offer to replace with something else.

Love alps! If your looking for home cooking and a friendly family place to eat, go here. Me and my husband go to alps a lot and the owners are always there and the nicest people always greeting you when you walk thru the door. There food is yummy I am yet to have a bad dish...there skillets are my favorite. Portion size is huge! I can never finish a plate. Not to mention super quick. Food comes out so fast!! The service is always great they always have such friendly people working there that make you feel like your at home having your mom cook for you. Don't have a bad thing to say. There old fashion and I love that.

Standard family restaurant fair. Soup was thickened with corn starch. Fair prices. Very standard. Seems very popular neighborhood location. Wasn't much of a fan of the Caesar dressing. Nothing seemed fresh or too appetizing

Round two was great! Had the pancakes with glazed crepes. Both were so good, maybe a bit too much strawberries but that's just me. The hash browns were a bit in the crispy side, a little black but overall good. Couldn't finish this time! Service was great and we were welcomed by the little old man.
I love coming here with my family on sunday  amazing food  amazing service  just love Alps

Best way to describe this place is "meh." good service for sure but food was bland and didn't taste very good and their skillet selection and ingredients chosen were odd. Plus on the free parking, service, diner atmosphere but I won't come back.

Having recently moved to the neighborhood we were eager to find a fantastic brunch spot and the reviews seemed pretty solid. However, disappointment was only a meal away. We were seated immediately and the waitress came by to take our drink order within a minute. The menu has a decent variety of breakfast options. The three of us all ordered different skillets. Sadly each one disappointed us. Nothing seemed cohesive. The hash browns were a bit underdone, the toast barely toasted, and the cheese on top wasn't even melted. In one of the skillets they chose to cook tomatoes rather than use fresh ones. The Chorizo skillet barely had any hash browns and had way too much meat, lacking any balance of flavors. The pancakes were decent in all fairness. For what is very much a diner-like restaurant, prices were a bit high considering what you get as well. We were really hoping for better =(

i'd really like to give this place 2.5 stars. i like alps and have been dining here for breakfast and lunch since they re-opened. the place is great and the staff is consistenly friendly.  but, having been here recently for breakfast, i noticed that their menu prices increased, to me, significantly.  we paid almost $40 for scrambled eggs and bacon w/the accoutrements, eggs benedicts, a breakfast sandwich and two coffees.  i'm with gary w., alps is very overpriced.  i don't think i'll be back for awhile.  it's too bad, i really like their food but it's way too pricey for a diner-like joint.

Childhood nostalgia here!! I went to their other location (Irving park Near Lincoln: now closed) since I was a child and I enjoyed brunch at alps for the longest time. Knowing this location is here brings joy and nostalgic moments every time! Brunch at alps is very comforting as well as yet bustling, seeing new people and the hustle and bustle of waitresses taking orders and bringing food. I go after Sunday mass and it's crazy but worth the wait. Sundays are the best! A bit pricy but worth the money spent! Customer service is up to par and beyond! Never had a bad experience in my many years being a loyal alps customer. Any imperfections were corrected quickly.  And yes, I plan to go there next Sunday.
Good dinner food at a reasonable price. Family owned with friendly service.  Good coffee and wonderful soups of the day. Can't go wrong.  Solid diner food that won't disappoint.

Absolutely love the alps. I can only speak for their breakfast, but isn't that the most important meal of the day!  - Amazing pancakes - Variety of options with plenty of healthy dishes and substitutes  - Fantastic Coffee - Unbeatable service

Variety, variety, variety and great prices for a whole lotta breakfast food! Parking in back, great service, plenty of seating and the coffee is ahhh flowing constantly which is a major bonus in my breakfast book! I ordered the Home Special with French toast, turkey sausage, eggs, and hash browns and walked out withy bill under $11! I like the open areas to eat here and the big comfy booths. They specialize in pancakes (huge variety) and the omelette specials are delicious as well. If you're looking for a great place to grab breakfast with a group for sone real food not specialty breakfast fufu that us over priced and small portions this place is for u!! Portions are large and the food tastes like grandma cooked it up in the kitchen! Friendly staff and I repeat parking lot in back!!! So no need to search and search for a spot on those chilly mornings!
The worst breakfast place I have encountered.  Food was cold when served, hash browns soggy and toast cold ! The worse thing about it was no one cared to make it better.  Don't waste your time.
Diner food that is a cut above.  Turkey in the club sandwich is from a house-roasted bird.  Go on a Thursday for the split pea soup with croutons, home-made and delicious.
Perfect brunch spot. Great for kids. Food is good and fast. Our daughter eats the pancakes like she's in a contest.

Yummmm... I dream about their omelettes, fluffy and baked - the BEST around!  Pancakes are delicious, coffee is always fresh.  They offer an early weekday morning (6-9am) breakfast special that can't be beat - lots of choices for about half the price you'd normally pay.  Staff is friendly, they don't hurry you along.  I also appreciate that the place is absolutely spotless.  My favorite breakfast spot in the city!

This restaurant is very close to my home. This Irving  Park stretch is not very glamorous so I did not know what to expect. But the food came out quick and delicious and the service was above average. Boyfriend and I plan to make this a regular joint.
Clean, brightly lit local breakfast/brunch. Reliably tasty and quick. Only reason I didn't give 5 stars was I felt the portion of French toast in their "house special" was cheap. (1pc cut in half)

This neighborhood place is reliable, with great food served quickly and at a reasonable price. The menu isn't as extensive as that of a Greek diner, but it's a helluva lot better than that of a Denny's or IHOP. TIP:  Ask to be seated in Maureen's section.  You'll be glad you did.
Awesome breakfast...great eggs and pancakes, not great.  Great service and no wait for Sunday brunch.

I don't see what the big deal is about this place.  My partner and I had breakfast here, I had the house special and he had strawberry pancakes.  Add in 2 cups of coffee and small oj, and the bill was $33! With tip, close to $40!   Our waitress was very nice..but honestly, for that kind of money for breakfast, I expect better.  I can find this type of fare at any Greek diner near my home for much less.  Bottom line, nothing special, overpriced.
Great food and great service. I ordered a basic breakfast, I believe it was the home special, but everything was perfect. My waitress was very kind and prompt.

Best breakfast in the city. This place is easy to get to, extremely clean, and has a gear varied menu. Have never had a bad meal there. Omelette was perfect! Fluffy and airy, all fresh ingredients. Great cup of bottomless coffee. The owners are hands on and you can see how much they care, plus they chose the right employees. Service is always friendly and attentive.

Came in here the other day and the food was better than when I came in in 2012. This time we ordered one of the skillets and I got the patty melt. The patty melt was good, lacked seasoning however but that is a quick fix. The skillet I was told was good, but bland as well. This place is really just okay, I think for what they charge for some items they would be 4 star worthy if they seasoned the food or if they dropped their prices to "diner" prices.

Don't order the Cesar salad. It's really Italian dressing although they won't admit it... Also their Cajun chicken was bland. My husband did enjoy his melt though. The staff seemed pretty disinterested in serving the customers.

Worst experience in my life. Took my dear friend who is a World War Veteran out to breakfast for his 93rd birthday along with his wife.  We were greeted by the owner who I let know that it was his birthday and he just seated us and walked away.  I ordered the Chorizo skillet which I have often ordered in other restaurants. Their chorizo however tasted awful and asked if I can order something else. The owner came over to our table and starts yelling at me saying "what am I supposed to do with this, its not my problem, its your problem." I explained that I did not like the taste of the chorizo and he starts waving his arms in the air and continued to scold me. To top it off, this guy didnt even have the decency to shake my friends hand and wish him a happy birthday or thank him for serving our country and  was too cheap to even give him a slice of cake, cupcake, something for his birthday. I will never come here again.

My sister recommended this place to me so I took my guests here. The food was just O.K., I think I've been to better brunch places. Pretty standard fare. I had cinnamon French toast and it was good, but I think I've had better elsewhere.

Friendly staff and fresh, tasty breakfast/lunch food, nothing extremely special, however definitely worth a try! Nice portion sizes, food could use a bit more flavor. I prefer this place over IHOP, IHOP's too mainstream (hipster speak, lols) I must visit again and find a favorite!

Friendly service. My group had the corned beef, eggs florentine, and steak with hash browns. Each meal was tasty. Good price. Small parking lot in rear. Good breakfast, brunch, lunch option. Specials available in early morning.

First time at this place. Run by Ted and Bob, I love that it's a family joint. Ted was so nice and hospitable, eugene and i felt so comfortable and welcome. The Irishman and breakfast burrito were solid. The only thing we would have wanted was the burrito to be less oily. 5 stars for cleanliness of the restaurant, nice staff, and good food!
Great breakfast place! Their skillets are delicious, and everything is really reasonably priced. The gyro omelette is a must-have

My buddy and I had breakfast at Alps West last Sunday. They do have a free parking lot behind the restaurant but it does fill up quickly. The restaurant also fills up, but there seemed to be a good flow of diners coming in and out so there never seemed to be a long line. There is a small foyer with bench seating and a pleasing Alpine scene on the wall if there is a line. We each ordered a breakfast special platter with eggs, hash brown potatoes, French toast and choice of meat. It was a filling breakfast though a bit on the bland side. Our waitress was attentive to our needs. They have good weekday morning specials if you live in the area.
This is my ALL TIME FAV PLACE FOR BREAKFAST! Great Staff and Great Food!! And theres parking in the back!!! We will be back!!!

This is my go to favorite breakfast place. They have all the classics you expect, great pancakes great egg dishes, lots of delicious skillets and so much more.  The service is great and the prices are fair. For an average breakfast meal, expect to spend $8-$10.
Good food, friendly service, over cooked or sat too long bacon.

If you are looking for a fantastic diner for breakfast, you've found it.  I have liked everything I've ordered here and I've been here at least 20 times!  My only complaint is that I had other breakfast diners that I used to like, but now I consider poor in comparison to ALPS. I'm a big fan of the Texas Omelette.

This is a very good breakfast diner. They have an large menu to choose from. Its not the cheapest place to eat but the food is great. The best part is, they have a free parking lot in the rear.  The place is clean and updated. The staff is friendly and attentive.

Free parking in the back! Breakfast place all day. Order the french toast- fluffy and tasty!!!! Great seating area, but only downfall is that the t.v. is just too in your face. I feel if you want to watch t.v. while you eat, stat at home and eat on your couch. The food was tasty, I have had better but the service was great. Very attentive and run by family, so they treat you the way the way they would want to be treated. Coffee keeps filled to the rim!

I've eaten here once a week for the last 8 months, and I have always had an above-average experience. The service is consistently friendly and prompt even when jam-packed (avoid after-church if you want to be seated quickly).  The food is excellent (I recommend the pancakes). The omelets are good, and with a side of hash browns and pancakes included, are a great value. The coffee has always been great. The decor is great. It looks very clean and modern. (My trip to a Denny's in Wisconsin prompted me to express my appreciation for this place. Also, avoid Denny's.)
Best breakfast location in the area.  Fairly traditional food, so nothing that will get you too excited.  Prices are good, servers are nice and a lot of options to choose from.
Had the typical breakfast food and it was what it was. They said their omelets are great so maybe on my next visit.

I have been to many breakfast diners in this city and I have not been able to settle down into one since I have been grieving the loss of Huck Finn.  Huck Finn is still around, but their service, quality of food, and drunken obnoxious crowds have prevented me from making any return visits. ALPS was very clean, the waitress was the nicest and genuinely friendliest waitress I have met in a very long time.  After little to no sleep from the night before I arrived here on a Friday morning (sober) and had no problems getting a table.  The food came super fast and was tasty.  Two of my friends ordered the skillets, both were excellent and I ordered the Big Man breakfast which was substantial and delicious.  It is a little out of the way for me since I live on the southside, but once I relocate further north, this will definitely become one of my go-to breakfast diners.

Brought the Goddaughter and her mom here one fine Saturday morning.  There were alot of other kids in the place.  I like to spoil the little one, so I let her order whatever she wanted on the menu, knowing that I would finish whatever she didn't want :) Great location for me.  Quick service.  Reasonable prices.  I got a skillet with a side of pancakes.  Love the portions.

ALPS is a solid, breakfast oriented diner. The food was ok, good but not exciting. I had the biscuits and gravy with sausage patties. It was a decent portion and tasted alright. They could have been a bit more generous with the gravy, but all in all it was A-OK. Christopher had a combination with eggs and sausage and potatoes and pancakes. He ate it up but wasn't overly impressed with it. One thing to note is the sausage patties have a very strong flavor. It was fine for us, but my Mom could not have eaten it.  The restaurant itself, is large, airy and clean. For a neighborhood spot, it is convenient and not bad at all.

Good food and service but for breakfast it's a bit pricey. Paid $29 for a 2 breakfasts (one waffle and one pancake) a side of bacon, a side of sausage, glass of milk and one cup of coffee. with the tip $35.00. I thought it was a bit steep for what we had. food - 4.5 stars service - 4.5 stars value - 1.5 stars

I don't know why I haven't gotten on here about Alps.  We get breakfast from them with great frequency, the hubs more often than me, and occasionally lunch.  Super nice folks, the ladies who wait tables are always nice and friendly, the food is good.  It's a little pricier than I expected but the portion sizes are pretty big.   I do wish they'd let me order off the kids menu for a smaller portion, but alas, not allowed. I do always ask for a little more chocolate in their chocolate milk, their bacon is on the thin side but decent, waffles and pancakes and french toast are all good.  All in all, a decent diner spot in a neighborhood so lacking in diner spots.

It's not often that I give breakfast joints five stars, but this place is truly the best. You know why? Because pancakes come with EVERYTHING! Well, maybe not everything, but close to everything.  For example, when I ordered a bacon and cheese omelet, I had the choice of getting it with toast or pancakes -- at no extra charge! Most breakfast places don't offer pancakes when you order an omelet. That was definitely a plus. I also liked how fluffy my omelet was, and the pancakes (as you would expect from a pancake house) were delicious.  I suppose one negative was that our server was loud and abrasive. She just didn't have that sweet folksy demeanor that you would expect from a waitress at a diner. The food came out fast, though, and, like I said, it was delicious, so I'm still giving this place five stars.  We will be back for sure! NOTE: While there is paid parking on the street in front of Alps, there's a free parking lot around back for restaurant customers.

This place is consistent.   Love coming here in the summer for brunch with our dog.   They are very accommodating on the patio, and they always bring her a bowl of water and a milkbone (which she's allergic to, but it's still really sweet). I almost always get a veggie omelet.    Nice and fluffly, and I find the veggies to taste really fresh.   Side of pancakes are not amazing, but they're definitely good.    I've always had friendly, fast service here.

To new traditions, old friends.  Looks like this is gonna be a family breakfast spot for pitter patter of feet.  Whoa, slow down!  Not us yet! But, I did accompany my friend and her kids, and the place is very kid friendly.  Enlarged booths, patient staff, coloring books and crayons.  I think the only thing left for the parents to ask for is a babysitter, and everyone is set.  Service is quick and out waitress set out our platters in record time for the hungry munchkins.  On the our breakfast menu: Butter, pancakes, bacon, butter, mushroom and tomato omelet, butter, fresh orange juice, butter, coffee, butter, and fruit garnish.  Omelet was juicy yet fluffy and huge serving size! Oh yes, and parking lot around the corner in the back for your mini vans.

Good diner option for the Old Irving neighborhood. Cleaner than the Golden Nugget chains this place seems to be a neighborhood favorite. I definitely need to give this place a second chance given that I didn't even select a meal based on the restaurant namesake. I was trying to be healthy and ordered the lox platter. Probably not the wisest choice as the salmon was just okay and a little stringy. I probably should have gone with pancakes. Service and seating was prompt and friendly. Next time I go back I'll have to make sure I'm not double booked for eating invitations.

The Alps fills the gap between overpriced, trendy cafés and greasy spoons. A baked omelette will cost upwards of $8 bit it is worth it. I had a baked egg white omelette with FRESH spinach, feta cheese and tomato and it was excellent. The banana Nutella crepes are a great choice for a dessert to share.  Support this family business! The hosts work very hard to please every guest.
We love this place. One of our favorites. The omelettes are baked, so they are light and fluffy. The Alps' Favorite Cinnamon Swirl French Toast is the best!

Excellent place!  I went on a Sunday morning around 9am and was quickly seated though there was a crowd.  I was with a 6, 4, and 1 1/2 year olds.  Service and food were great, will definately go again.  Strongly recommend.

Double date with Sa re re and Lou! Came 11/6.... Busy on a Sunday, waited about 10-15 min...Which wasn't bad for a Sunday morning! Cream of potato soup and club sandwhich is delicioso!! Paid under $25 for four people..which is def. a steal! Must come back!

Here are a few convenient positions to use while eating at this magnificent, deceptively European pancake house and diner. Position One: THE NOM-NOM ATTACK After you get your food, prepare your arsenal of culinary cutlery in your hands and dig into that skillet.  Left hook, slice. Right jab, scoop. Left hook, stuff. Right jab, sip.  Continue until your breakfast enemy is nothing but a stain on the plate. Position Two: THE SIP-SIP STARE DOWN If you are at ALPS to look at the non-existent mountains, take a break with a coffee and newspaper.  Try and stay calm as the raging caffeine courses through your veins.  Unbeknownst to you, this coffee-drinking ritual is a test of wills.  Which will come first, the check, or your sanity? Position Three: THE NEGOTIATOR Diners, drive-ins and dives got you coo-coo for hot cocoa?  Don't know what I'm talking about? It's because those sneaky waitresses have their own code, lingo, razzle-dazzle sheesh boom bah.  Did you order a triple decker omelette, hold the italian, double-Sparten with extra hashies? Maybe whatever that was will taste good with your hunka-hunka O.J. freshly squeezed.  Nod and smile, negotiator, nod and smile. These tips and tricks are sure to net you a wonderful time at ALPS West Restaurant & Pancake house.  Auf wiedersehen diner-seeker, and enjoy!

I know I've said this before, but seriously, who isn't a sucker for a good diner? ALPS is probably one of the best diners I've been to the city thus far, and I secretly love it because it makes me feel like I am back home in the burbs (ya, I'm a dork).  I was told it gets prettyyy busy on Sunday mornings, so our party of 3 ventured out a little early to get a table. Luckily, we were seated right away and our orders were taken soon after. They have really great service, and the food is fabulous. I absolutely love any type of skillet, so I went with the Gypsy--ham, cheddar cheese, bell peppers, and onions all on a bed of hash browns, and 2 eggs over-easy to top it off. Holy yum. Highly recommended. They also serve lunch and dinner, and seem to have really great specials. I would come back to check those out, too. ALPS is awesome.

I work pretty far from home so I never eat at the places near my house for lunch.  I happened to have a Doctor appointment a few weeks ago so I worked from home.  Hungry and unable to muster up the strength to actually cook for myself, I went to Alps.   OMG!!!  I talk it back!  You aren't under seasoned!  You are amazing!  I ordered a chicken sandwich.  Well, it come with a soup.  Whenever someone says that to me I immediately think "oh...  yay..  a filler..."  No!  This soup was so good, amazing, magical even!  I got the a vegetable soup.  I was using the amazing selection of breads they gave me to sop up every last bit of that soup.  A few minutes later my meal came.  The chicken on my sandwich was an actual whole chicken breast either pounded or cut thin...  it was twice the size of the bun.  It had bacon and mushrooms and cheese on it!  Three of my favorite things!  I barely at from the mountain of fries on my plate because the soup had already filled me up and the sandwich was too good to leave any of it.   I love you Alps!  I'll be back for lunch as soon as I can.  Maybe I should just go for dinner... Mmmm... that sounds like a good idea!

Very nice, clean, comfortable, friendly, good food, reasonably priced diner.  The split pea soup was outstanding!  The menu was good although I had really expected to be able to find meatloaf; I was happy with the corned beef and cabbage special I ordered.  I was there on a Thursday night around 7pm and it was not crowded.  I was glad to get one of the last available booths.  Overall a very good experience.

The place is  welcoming, warm, and cozy. A nice breakfast & brunch restaurant. I enjoy going there on Sunday morning. It's a nice place to start Sunday layback morning. I normally order omelette. I have had Feta Cheese Omelette with Tomatoes and Onions, Denver Omelette, Spanish Omelette and Corned Beef Omelette. I liked all omelette that I had there. The hash browns are very good and pancakes as well. The coffee is little too thin for me but it's ok. I don't need caffeine kicks so much on Sunday. The waitress are vey friendly.

This is a pleasant place to go and spend some time chatting and eating, but the food it's just ok. First time I've been there I ordered one skillet, which didn't seem to be very seasoned, and this is totally a "must" for me. My second time I ordered mushroom crepe, which didn't had a greta flavor as well, was kind of grease and the appearance was ugly, like it was done on a hurry. Altought my experience wasn't awesome, I would return.  If you're not too picky, worth checking it out.

This place is great, a nice clean hopping diner but in a real neighborhood where the locals actually eat there on Sunday morning! Service was great had ice waters and coffee within moments of sitting down. Hubby tried the Irish skillet, it was huge and had big chunks of real corned beef in it, not bits of corned beef like substance that you find at some other breakfast places!  I tried the ladies sampler, it was all standard fare but cooked well, the pancakes were delicious, just one step under Ihop. Say what you will about Ihop but they know their pancakes!  All in all a great experience and solid food! I love the fact that some of the breakfast specials actually come with orange juice, I have never seen that before!

I entered ALPS in perhaps the ideal circumstances. I was starving and slightly hungover. Although at an intersection plagued with scrappy storefronts, this is a clean family restaurant. I sat outside as the weather called for it but also a lingering hangover and anyone's kids is not how to set up for a good dining experience.  The staff is friendly and perhaps too busy to get to the tables swiftly. Once my order was in it came back about 10-15 minutes which on a busy Sunday morning is nuts. I went eggs, but could have, should have, and will some day get the pancakes.  If you're looking for a solid family/Greek style restaurant that has reasonable prices and expected wait time, come here. If you're looking to hit a gourmet palace of pancakes and glazes, google hipster food.  Will l return? It's likely, how could you not want to try the pancakes at a pancake house?

Fluffiest Egg White omelet around. Really? Yes really!  Most of the breakfast joints around Albany Park/Irving Park are diner dives. Tons of butter, lots of grease, (great for a hangover) but just not healthy. This is not true about the ALPS. The owners are sweet, the waitstaff has sass, and there is generally no longer than a 10 minute wait on Saturday or Sunday. No extra charge to sub fruit for hash browns, although an egg-white omelet does tend to run quite a bit extra. 2 coffee's, 2 egg-white omelets = $27 (ouch)

Not to be confused with Alps East:  yelp.com/biz/alps-east-r… The service is good, friendly, and as fast as possible when they're busy which is most of the time. We've been in a few times now and each time we've had the same level of service, same quality of yummy breakfast food. They've been really good with our kids too. This is our new breakfast go-to place.

Have you ever been to a clean, well-lit diner? No? Before coming to ALPS, neither had I.  I usually prefer my diner experience to be of the greasy spoon variety, so, I was a bit skeptical on my first visit here. Upon first walking in, I thought this can't be good, everything looks so clean and sterile - Turns out I had absolutely nothing to worry about!  ALPS has a killer breakfast, lunch, and dinner menu and great service. If you visit between 6 - 9 AM you can order the early bird special which is your choice of one of their popular breakfasts for just 4.99. I've ordered the pancakes, french toast, and crepes. All were excellent. If you love diners, do yourself a favor and check this place out. It can get busy on the weekends, but I've never had to wait long. Worth it.

A nice, clean, bright neighborhood diner - great for breakfast and lunch.  This is the place I meet my girlfriends at before a day of serious shopping. The food is diner-good, the noise level is low to average for this kind of place, so you can have conversations. The friendly waitresses never make you feel like they want to push you out, so lingering conversations over ever-filled cups of coffee are possible.  We always see neighborhood people we know there, so a bit of table-hopping and greeting is the norm. A real asset to the neighborhood - you don't see too many places like this anymore!

I've been here twice: once for breakfast and once for lunch.  Both times, I would say the food was average.  Not average-bad just average in general  The portions are definitely healthy in size.  The food is good.  It's just not anything to write home about.  The coffee was "eh" but the service is friendly and consistent..  If you're in the neighborhood, stop in and try it out but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.

Doubled up at ALPS West for breakfast this weekend.  Saturday, I went for the Kentucky Derby Breakfast consisting of 2 biscuits with gravy, 3 eggs and 3 sausage patties.  It was pure hillbilly delight on a plate, although my over medium eggs were far to runny, I'll just go scrambled next time.  On Sunday I went with Jerry's mess.  A slung-together creation of scrambled eggs, hash browns, sausage, peppers, and onions.  This was a very good breakfast.   ALPS west is a clean and bright, the staff is very good.  They keep the coffee and ice water coming and are very friendly.  Prices are competitive with most of the other joints you can find.  The wife also approved.  All in all a great time was had in Old Irving.  I'll definitely be back!

WARNING: Don't be fooled! It's the same old diner food you love, but at jacked-up prices and with a mostly terrible staff. The service is hit-or-miss. One server who works there is really over-the-top friendly, the rest are NOT. Last time I was there, my friendmade it very clear to the waitress that she is allergic to bread, and 4 minutes later the waitress plopped a basket full of bread right in front of her face. I guess you can't expect diner staff to be aware of food allergies, but come on. It didn't exactly inspire her to feel safe about her meal. The owner is a real crazy person, definitely the agressive macho type. What a jerk. I've seen him badger customers and employees. One time me and some friends waited a really long time for the server to even glance at our table. Finally one of us went to the front counter to ask if we even had a server because we were about to walk out the door. The server finally came over and gave us this big attitude, and she kept saying, "what's the problem? I gave you this sign (sticks pointer finger in the air), like, one minute, I was telling you to wait one minute, what's the problem?" The problem is we didn't see your hand gesture across the room, and we want service, not to attitude and "one minute." How rude and just plain stupid. The food is OK, basically the same thing you can find at many similar pancake houses. One thing I noticed is that, according to my taste buds, their food is seriously and consistently under-salted. That leaves everything just a little bit bland. Considering you can find this EXACT food at every other diner in Chicago, the prices are way too high. I would probably never would have gone here if it wasn't sooooo close to where I live. As it was, I used to eat at Alps about once a month since they opened, just for the convenience (worth noting that I always regretted the greasy expensive meal once I get the inevitable Alps stomach ache). However, I can say I will never, ever be going back after my last experience. It was just one thing after another and we ended up walking out and happily finding better food elsewhere. I was a regular, and they've lost my business forever. My tip: if you walk in either direction on Irving Park for half a mile you will find another diner with the same food for less money and less attitude.

Gypsy skillet & country fried skillet were both very tasty. Prices were great for two people leaving with leftovers ($23, and we both ordered a drink too). They even had flavored creamer already on the table for my coffee! Our waitress was fast and friendly. Would definitely go here again for a laid back brunch or with a small group, but their parking lot was sort of difficult to get to from the direction we came (on Elston).

Yes fiver stars may be a bit skew for this place but when you compare it to other places in the immediate neighbor you might tend to agree with me. So an altered review would still get 4 stars. Sure you could say it's just another diner similar to Golden Nugget but it's much better and significantly cheaper to. Around $10 per person including tip. Also don't be fooled by the outside the diner is  a lot bigger then it looks from the outside.  Food is slightly better then you're average diner and service is just as good. The  pancakes are amazing good as well.... no boxed crap here. I'll guarantee that I I will back here again.

The menu is interesting because they have so many different specials that are very similar...but everything was cooked well, the prices were reasonable, and the place is very clean.   I wasn't going to get coffee, but they had hazelnut and French vanilla creamer at the table so I had to get a cup (or as it turns out, 3 cups).   This place isn't trendy or different, but it's a solid, simple breakfast place.

stopped in for brunch before church today - really wanted to try something new but stuck with the big man (eggs, pancakes, hashbrowns, sausage patties)  i am increasing the rating to 3 stars cuz this meal really hit the spot. i was looking at other tables around us and i saw everything from pancakes with strawberries / whipped cream to crepes. all look very good and i think i even drooled a little bit. im hoping my first experience here was just a fluke. i really want to order something other than the basic breakfast meal. hopefully next time we stop in here i will have the courage to do so.  either way, this place deserves credit for being completely full and getting patrons in and out in under 45 minutes.

I always walk out of this place full, and thinking I got a bargain. It's a little less expensive than other breakfast places, the staff is great, and any time we take someone from out of town here, you know what they request the next time? Yep, Alps. I would recommend to anyone and everyone.

I really wanted to like this place. I really, really did. The food came out fast, but the eggs atop my Wanderer skillet were overcooked and the hash browns I specifically asked to be prepared "crispy" were undercooked. The pieces of bacon I tried to ignore in this skillet were the kind of pieces I'd spit out if I were eating a strip of it-- white, fatty, chewy and again, undercooked. There were supposed to be tomatoes in this skillet- and I'm sure they were in there, but they certainly weren't red and they didn't taste ripe. I dunno, it IS only April.... The pancakes everyone raves about on here were dry- even with strawberry glaze and whipped topping. I'd like to say I'd give this place a second chance, because like I said, I REALLY wanted to like it, but here's why I won't. Of the 5 major breakfast staples: Bacon (meats) Egg preparation Pancakes Hash browns Coffee (maybe orange juice) Only the coffee was passable. Everything else was pretty much a fail. I hit every staple with the breakfast I ordered and they flubbed at 80%. Coffee doesn't keep me coming back. I'll give 2 stars for cleanliness and friendliness of staff.
Pretty good stuff. The decor is modern and very clean and nice. The food was pretty good for dieting Egg beater omelet with broccoli and cheese. The parking is in year rear which is really nice.

Great neighborhood breakfast/brunch spot. I discovered it not long after moving to the neighborhood. This is a former WaMu bank branch, and they've kept some of the WaMu interior styling, which actually works well for them. The breakfasts are very good, and I'm particularly fond of their breakfast skillets. It's worth the trip!

I love it here.  The waffles are great and the waitstaff and Bob are very friendly.  Our coffee and water are always full. We just feel comfortable here, it's clean and bright. We usually come in on weekday mornings as my boyfriend works all weekend so it's not as busy as the weekenders have dealt with.

Best breakfest/brunch spot in my neighborhood. I have been here twice and have been every satisfied. The first time I came I had the breakfast burrito with chorizo with rice and beans and it was really delicious and filling. On the second visit I had the hobo skillet and that was very good as well with lots of veggies and meat  and hash browns. Also the service was very fast with very little wait time even when they were busy. I will def be back and try out their other breakfast items.

Really like this place. Here's why: Great, varied menu. Lots of options. Very good food. Bacon: yum. Eggs: cooked perfectly. 3 options for adding cream to my coffee already on the table? Yes, thank you! Very clean place (as others have mentioned), friendly servers (including the owner who greets and seats you). Great neighborhood crowd. Inexpensive compared to similar places. Free parking lot. Alps, I wish you a long, happy life.

It took a while, but we did try Alps again. We went with a group of 4 and were seating promptly. Service was a little strange. Our server made weird comments but we got what we ordered and the food was pretty good.  We won't be making this a regular place on our breakfast rotation, but I did at least give it a chance.
The food, service and host was great. More than enough portions.  The food was fresh.  Fast and hospitable service.  All you need from a great family breakfast place minus the drunks.

I went to this restaurant by myself on a Saturday, about 1:00p.m. I've worked in the restaurant industry and didn't want to go during 'prime time.'  With a newspaper under my arm I entered the restaurant and requested a table. The woman asked me if I wanted to sit at the counter. "No" but it seemed there were no tables available. I didn't mind waiting and let her know. 5 min passed and then ten 10 min - there was no one else in line behind me.  I watched the occupied booth empty and another table leave. Yet for whatever reason, I wasn't seated. As this was supposed to be "Me time" I was patient, but wondered what in the heck was going on. 15 min later I stopped the man who worked there (the owner) and asked him what the delay was. He "didn't know" and had the woman (other owner) come over to tell me that because I was ONE PERSON I couldn't sit at the 4-top table or a booth, and that I had to wait longer. When I said, But You Have Had That Table Empty Ever Since I Got Here, she didn't care - - you see, "I" wasn't a party of 4. Their 2 little booths were still empty and I asked about them but NO, I WAS BY MYSELF and could not sit there. UNBELIEVABLE!   So then, after almost 20 min of waiting, I left.  Never to dirty my feet in there again!!! *********************************** I rec'd a "love letter" from shinx calling me spoiled. Huh? Spoiled cuz they would not seat me even tho there were tables open? What a nuthead.

Meh.  The only thing exceptional about this place is how clean it is (for a diner).  I was also pleased that Hubs and I were able to get seats right away at 11:30am on a Sunday.  If we didn't live down the block though, I don't really think we'd come here again.   The food is pretty bland!  Hubs ordered this breakfast tortilla that had peppers, chorizo and egg in it that sounded flavorful on the menu, but left much to be desired.  The chorizo looked like reconstituted meat from Taco Bell.  He drowned it in hot sauce just to get it to taste like something, which still wasn't much.  And the hashbrowns were also mushy and flavorless.   My three deuces were adequate, but for almost $7.00... it left me disappointed.  Maybe I just have too high of diner expectations.  I'm sure we will come back since we live so close, at which point I think I'll give one of their skillets a try.
